p: Case 5: A 46-year-old woman complained of intermittent fever and severe headache for 3 days, and her husband who just returned from Wuhan, China on 2020, January, 12. She was then diagnosed COVID-19 by RT-PCR. During admission, she received dexamethasone 4 mg 3 doses as 12 h apart due to hypersensitivity to NSAIDs. Her fever and headache subsided after 5 days under supportive observation. Three consecutive tests were negative, and she was discharged on illness day 32 in stable condition and a chest CT was performed ( Fig. 1, Panel E).
